description: should have more features such as selecting objects
I don't want to use Gimp all the time! Finding a simple painting tool like MS Paint was surprisingly difficult. But CorePaint does the job.

a really good app; nice and simple and straightforward to use which is what i've been looking for. 
it could do with a zoom tool, as has been mentioned. and also the ability to see what size the brush is, and a way to select objects with transparency. it would also be nice to have the tools in one area rather than clicking between the different sections.
summary: just what i was looking for

description: When you install CorePaint and open, the app opens a blank canvas with no tools. Clicking around doesn't do anything or write or draw anything. There are no shapes, nothing. It's a completely useless app. You can save or create new canvases that have the exact same issue. I tried for 45 minutes to figure out what was wrong. It's really disappointing. Save your time and don't install.
You want MS Paint on Linux? This is literally the same but different UI.
